title:
A Setup to Study Atomic State Population Dynamics and Optical
  Polarization at CRYRING@ESR
authors:
K. Mohr (1 and 2), R. S\'anchez (3), W. N\"ortersh\"auser (1 and 2),
  Z. Andelkovic (3), V. Hannen (4), E.-O. Hanu (3), F. Herfurth (3), R. He{\ss}
  (3), M. Horst (1 and 2), P. Imgram (1), K. K\"onig (1 and 2), C. Krantz (3),
  M. Lestinsky (3), Yu. A. Litvinov (3 and 2), E. Menz (3 and 5), P. M\"uller
  (1), J. Palmes (1), S. Rausch (1 and 2), T. Ratajczyk (1), L. Renth (1), J.
  Rossbach (3), R. S. Sidhu (3), F. Sommer (1), J. Spahn (1), N. Stallkamp (3
  and 5), K. Ueberholz (4), G. Vorobjev (3), C. Weinheimer (4), D. Zisis (1)
  ((1) Institut f\"ur Kernphysik, Technische Universit\"at Darmstadt, Germany
  (2) Helmholtz Forschungsakademie Hessen f\"ur FAIR (HFHF), GSI
  Helmholtzzentrum f\"ur Schwerionenforschung, Campus Darmstadt, Germany (3)
  GSI Helmholtzzentrum f\"ur Schwerionenforschung GmbH, Darmstadt, Germany (4)
  Institut f\"ur Kernphysik, Universit\"at M\"unster, Germany (5) Institut

abstract:
We present a recently established setup for laser spectroscopy at CRYRING@ESR
at the GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research. Here, laser spectroscopy
can be performed on stored and cooled ion bunches and coasting beams. First
spectra of $^{24,25}$Mg$^+$ ions are presented that were recorded by classical
Doppler-limited fluorescence spectroscopy as well as $\Lambda$-spectroscopy
using counter- and copropagating laser beams that are Doppler-shifted by
several nm.
